{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.06936v1", "title": "On Macdonald expansions of $q$-chromatic symmetric functions and the
  Stanley-Stembridge Conjecture", "summary": "The Stanley-Stembridge conjecture asserts that the chromatic symmetric
function of a $(3+1)$-free graph is $e$-positive. Recently, Hikita proved this
conjecture by giving an explicit $e$-expansion of the Shareshian-Wachs
$q$-chromatic refinement for unit interval graphs. Using the $\mathbb{A}_{q,t}$
algebra, we give an expansion of these $q$-chromatic symmetric functions into
Macdonald polynomials. Upon setting $t=1$, we obtain another proof of the
Stanley-Stembridge conjecture and rederive Hikita's formula. Upon setting
$t=0$, we obtain an expansion into Hall-Littlewood symmetric functions.", "main_category": "math.CO", "categories": "math.CO,math.RT", "published": "2025-04-09T14:41:20Z"}
